verses.verse: Woe<WH1945> to you that spoil<WH7703>, and you were not spoiled<WH7703>; and deal treacherously<WH898>, and they dealt not treacherously<WH898> with you when you shall cease<WH8552> to plunder<WH7703>, you shall be spoiled<WH7703>; and when you shall make a end<WH5239> to dealing treacherously<WH898>, they shall deal treacherously with you<WH898>.
O Lord<WH3068>, be gracious<WH2603> unto us<WH6960>; we have waited for you<WH2220>: be you our arm every morning<WH1242>, our salvation<WH3444> also in the time<WH6256> of trouble<WH6869>.
At the noise<WH6963> of the tumult<WH1995> the people<WH5971> fled<WH5074>; at the lifting up<WH7427> of yourself the nations<WH1471> were scattered<WH5310>.
And your plunder<WH7998> shall be gathered<WH622> like the gathering<WH625> of the caterpillar<WH2625>: as the running to and forth<WH4944> of locusts<WH1357> shall he run upon them<WH8264>.
The Lord<WH3068> is exalted<WH7682>; for he dwells<WH7931> on high<WH4791>: he has filled<WH4390> Zion<WH6726> with judgment<WH4941> and righteousness<WH6666>.
And wisdom<WH2451> and knowledge<WH1847> shall be the stability<WH530> of your times<WH6256>, and strength<WH2633> of salvation<WH3444>: the fear<WH3374> of the Lord<WH3068> is his treasure<WH214>.
Behold<WH691>, their valiant ones shall cry<WH6817> outside<WH2351>: the ambassadors<WH4397> of peace<WH7965> shall weep<WH1058> bitterly<WH4751>.

The highways<WH4546> lie waste<WH8074>, the wayfaring man<WH5674> ceases<WH7673>: he has broken<WH6565> the covenant<WH1285>, he has despised<WH3988> the cities<WH5892>, he regards<WH2803> no man<WH582>.

The earth<WH776> mourns<WH56> and languishes<WH535>: Lebanon<WH3844> is ashamed<WH2659> and cut down<WH7060>: Sharon<WH8289> is like a wilderness<WH6160>; and Bashan<WH1316> and Carmel<WH3760> shake off their fruits<WH5287>.
Now will I rise<WH6965>, says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>; now will I be exalted<WH7426>; now will I lift up myself<WH5375>.
You shall conceive<WH2029> chaff<WH2842>, you shall bring forth<WH3205> stubble<WH7179>: your breath<WH7307>, as fire<WH784>, shall devour you<WH398>.
And the people<WH5971> shall be as the burnings<WH4955> of lime<WH7875>: as thorns<WH6975> cut up<WH3683> shall they be burned<WH3341> in the fire<WH784>.
Hear<WH8085>, you that are far off<WH7350>, what I have done<WH6213>; and<WH7138>, you that are near, acknowledge<WH3045> my might<WH1369>.

The sinners<WH2400> in Zion<WH6726> are afraid<WH6342>; fearfulness<WH7461> has surprised<WH270> the hypocrites<WH2611>. Who among us shall live<WH1481> with the devouring<WH398> fire<WH784>? who among us shall live<WH1481> with everlasting<WH5769> burnings<WH4168>?

He that walks<WH1980> righteously<WH6666>, and speaks<WH1696> uprightly<WH4339>; he that despises<WH3988> the gain<WH1215> of oppressions<WH4642>, that shakes<WH5287> his hands<WH3709> from holding<WH8551> of bribes<WH7810>, that stops<WH331> his ears<WH241> from hearing<WH8085> of blood<WH1818>, and shuts<WH6105> his eyes<WH5869> from seeing<WH7200> evil<WH7451>;
He shall live<WH7931> on high<WH4791>: his place of defense<WH4869> shall be the forts<WH4679> of rocks<WH5553>: bread<WH3899> shall be given<WH5414> him<WH4325>; his waters shall be sure<WH539>.
Your eyes<WH5869> shall see<WH2372> the king<WH4428> in his beauty<WH3308>: they shall behold<WH7200> the land<WH776> that is very far off<WH4801>.
Your heart<WH3820> shall meditate<WH1897> terror<WH367>. Where is the scribe<WH5608>? where is the receiver<WH8254>? where is he that counted<WH5608> the towers<WH4026>?

You shall not see<WH7200> a fierce<WH3267> people<WH5971>, a people<WH5971> of a deeper<WH6012> speech<WH8193> than you can perceive<WH8085>; of a stammering<WH3932> tongue<WH3956>, that you can not understand<WH998>.

Look<WH2372> upon Zion<WH6726>, the city<WH7151> of our solemnities<WH4150>: your eyes<WH5869> shall see<WH7200> Jerusalem<WH3389> a quiet<WH7600> habitation<WH5116>, a tabernacle<WH168> that shall not be taken down<WH6813>; not one of the stakes<WH3489> there shall ever<WH5331> be removed<WH5265>, neither shall any of the cords<WH2256> there be broken<WH5423>.

But there the glorious<WH117> Lord<WH3068> will be unto us a place<WH4725> of broad<WH7342> rivers<WH5104> and streams<WH2975>; where shall go<WH3212> no<WH1077> galley<WH590> with oars<WH7885>, neither shall gallant<WH117> boat<WH6716> pass thereby<WH5674>.
For the Lord<WH3068> is our judge<WH8199>, the Lord<WH3068> is our lawgiver<WH2710>, the Lord<WH3068> is our king<WH4428>; he will save us<WH3467>.

Your riggings<WH2256> are loosened<WH5203>; they could not well<WH3653> strengthen<WH2388> their mast<WH8650>, they could not spread<WH6566> the sail<WH5251>: then is the prey<WH5706> of a great<WH4766> plunder<WH7998> divided<WH2505>; the lame<WH6455> take<WH962> the prey<WH957>.
And the inhabitant<WH7934> shall not say<WH559>, I am sick<WH2470>: the people<WH5971> that live<WH3427> in it shall be forgiven<WH5375> their iniquity<WH5771>.
